content:
As an AI language model, I do not have personal preferences or can plan a trip for a specific individual. However, here are some general suggestions for planning an itinerary to explore all the famous natural wonders of Cape Province in the shortest possible time:

1. Decide on the duration of your trip and make a rough budget.
2. Research and list down all the natural wonders you want to visit in Cape Province, including national parks, beaches, mountains, and wildlife sanctuaries.
3. Check the distance and travel time between each destination, and prioritize the ones that are closer together to make the most of your time.
4. Book your accommodations and activities in advance to avoid last-minute hassles.
5. Consider renting a car to have more flexibility and save time on transportation.
6. Start from Cape Town and explore nearby attractions like Table Mountain, Robben Island, and the Cape of Good Hope.
7. Drive to the Garden Route and visit places like Tsitsikamma National Park, Knysna, and Plettenberg Bay.
8. Head towards the eastern part of the province to see the Baviaanskloof Wilderness Area, Addo Elephant National Park, and the magnificent Drakensberg Mountains.
9. Take a detour to the West Coast to see the Namaqualand Flowers during the spring.
10. Don't forget to spend some time in the wine country, sampling the finest wines of South Africa.

Remember to keep some flexibility in your itinerary to allow for unexpected experiences and to appreciate the beauty and diversity of Cape Province at your own pace.
